  • Method
edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Control

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Control

  • public class Control
extends java.lang.Object
    LOL Games have a heads-up display (hud). The hud is a place for displaying text and drawing touchable buttons, so that as the hero moves through the level, the buttons and text can remain at the same place on the screen. This class encapsulates all of the touchable buttons.

    • Method Detail

      • addPauseButton

        public static Control addPauseButton(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     int width,
                                     int height,
                                     java.lang.String imgName)
        Add a button that pauses the game (via a single tap) by causing a PauseScene to be displayed. Note that you must configure a PauseScene, or pressing this button will cause your game to crash.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button

      • addMoveButton

                                    int y,

                                    java.lang.String imgName,
                                    Actor actor,
                                    float dx,
                                    float dy)
        Add a button that makes an actor move as long as the button is being held down
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        actor - The actor to move downward
        dx - The new X velocity
        dy - The new Y velocity

      • addTurboButton

        public static Control addTurboButton(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     int width,
                                     int height,
                                     java.lang.String imgName,
                                     int rateDownX,
                                     int rateDownY,
                                     int rateUpX,
                                     int rateUpY,
                                     Actor actor)
        Add a button that moves the given actor at one speed when it is depressed, and at another otherwise
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        rateDownX - Rate (X) at which the actor moves when the button is pressed
        rateDownY - Rate (Y) at which the actor moves when the button is pressed
        rateUpX - Rate (X) at which the actor moves when the button is not pressed
        rateUpY - Rate (Y) at which the actor moves when the button is not pressed
        actor - The actor that the button controls

      • addDampenedMotionButton

                                              float rateX,
                                              float rateY,
                                              float dampening,
                                              Actor actor)
        Add a button that moves the given actor at one speed, but doesn't immediately stop the actor when the button is released
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        rateX - Rate (X) at which the actor moves when the button is pressed
        rateY - Rate (Y) at which the actor moves when the button is pressed
        actor - The actor that the button controls

      • addThrowButton

        public static Control addThrowButton(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     int width,
                                     int height,
                                     java.lang.String imgName,
                                     Hero h,
                                     int milliDelay,
                                     float offsetX,
                                     float offsetY,
                                     float velocityX,
                                     float velocityY)
        Add a button to make the hero throw a projectile
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        milliDelay - A delay between throws, so that holding doesn't lead to too many throws at once
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        velocityX - The X velocity of the projectile when it is thrown
        velocityY - The Y velocity of the projectile when it is thrown

      • addSingleThrowButton

        public static Control addSingleThrowButton(int x,
                                           int y,
                                           int width,
                                           int height,
                                           java.lang.String imgName,
                                           Hero h,
                                           float offsetX,
                                           float offsetY,
                                           float velocityX,
                                           float velocityY)
        Add a button to make the hero throw a projectile, but holding doesn't make it throw more often
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        velocityX - The X velocity of the projectile when it is thrown
        velocityY - The Y velocity of the projectile when it is thrown

      • addDirectionalThrowButton

        public static Control addDirectionalThrowButton(int x,
                                                int y,
                                                int width,
                                                int height,
                                                java.lang.String imgName,
                                                Hero h,
                                                long milliDelay,
                                                float offsetX,
                                                float offsetY)
        The default behavior for throwing is to throw in a straight line. If we instead desire that the projectiles have some sort of aiming to them, we need to use this method, which throws toward where the screen was pressed Note: you probably want to use an invisible button that covers the screen...
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        milliDelay - A delay between throws, so that holding doesn't lead to too many throws at once
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile

      • addDirectionalSingleThrowButton

        public static Control addDirectionalSingleThrowButton(int x,
                                                      int y,
                                                      int width,
                                                      int height,
                                                      java.lang.String imgName,
                                                      Hero h,
                                                      float offsetX,
                                                      float offsetY)
        This is almost exactly like addDirectionalThrowButton. The only difference is that holding won't cause the hero to throw more projectiles
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile

      • addZoomOutButton

        public static Control addZoomOutButton(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       java.lang.String imgName,
                                       float maxZoom)
        Display a zoom out button. Note that zooming in and out does not work well with elements that hover on the screen. Use with care.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        maxZoom - Maximum zoom. 8 is usually a good default

      • addZoomInButton

        public static Control addZoomInButton(int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int width,
                                      int height,
                                      java.lang.String imgName,
                                      float minZoom)
        Display a zoom in button
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        minZoom - Minimum zoom. 0.25f is usually a good default

      • addRotateButton

        public static Control addRotateButton(int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int width,
                                      int height,
                                      java.lang.String imgName,
                                      float rate,
                                      Hero h)
        Add a button that rotates the hero
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        rate - Amount of rotation to apply to the hero on each press

      • addCallbackControl

        public static Control addCallbackControl(int x,
                                         int y,
                                         int width,
                                         int height,
                                         java.lang.String imgName,
                                         LolCallback callback)
        Add a button to the heads-up display that runs custom code via an onControlPress callback
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        callback - The code to run when the button is pressed

      • addOneTimeCallbackControl

        public static Control addOneTimeCallbackControl(int x,
                                                int y,
                                                int width,
                                                int height,
                                                java.lang.String activeImgName,
                                                java.lang.String inactiveImgName,
                                                LolCallback callback)
        Add a button to the heads-up display that runs custom code via an onControlPress callback, but the button only works once
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        activeImgName - The name of the image to display before the button is pressed. Use "" for an invisible button
        inactiveImgName - The name of the image to display after the button is pressed.
        callback - The code to run in response to the control press

      • addPanControl

        public static Control addPanControl(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int width,
                                    int height,
                                    java.lang.String imgName)
        Allow panning to view more of the screen than is currently visible
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button

      • addPinchZoomControl

        public static Control addPinchZoomControl(int x,
                                          int y,
                                          int width,
                                          int height,
                                          java.lang.String imgName,
                                          float maxZoom,
                                          float minZoom)
        Allow pinch-to-zoom
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        maxZoom - The maximum zoom (out) factor. 8 is usually a good choice.
        minZoom - The minimum zoom (int) factor. .25f is usually a good choice.

      • addVerticalBar

        public static Control addVerticalBar(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     int width,
                                     int height,
                                     java.lang.String imgName,
                                     LolCallback callback)
        Add an image to the heads-up display that changes its clipping rate to seem to grow vertically, without stretching. Touching the image causes its scale (0-100) to be sent to a ControlPressactor event
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        callback - The code to run when the bar is pressed

      • addRotator

        public static Control addRotator(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int width,
                                 int height,
                                 java.lang.String imgName,
                                 float delta,
                                 LolCallback callback)
        Add a rotating button that generates a ControlPressactor event and passes the rotation to the handler.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        delta - Amount of rotation to add during each fraction of a second
        callback - The code to run when the rotator is pressed

      • addImage

        public static Control addImage(int x,
                               int y,
                               int width,
                               int height,
                               java.lang.String imgName)
        Add an image to the heads-up display. Touching the image has no effect
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
